body:
Turboshaft MachineLoweringReducer handling ObjectIsOp::Kind::kUndetectable

File: compiler/turboshaft/machine-lowering-reducer-inl.h
Symbol: MachineLoweringReducer::REDUCE(ObjectIs)

Key excerpts:
- In the REDUCE(ObjectIs) implementation, for case ObjectIsOp::Kind::kUndetectable: it first checks if (DependOnNoUndetectableObjectsProtector()) then returns a check that input is undefined or null (TaggedEqual checks against factory_->undefined_value and null_value). If the protector dependence is false (protector invalid), falls through to generic map-bit undetectable check.
- There are multiple references in this REDUCE handling that call DependOnNoUndetectableObjectsProtector() and otherwise load map -> check IsUndetectableBit.

File/lines: compiler/turboshaft/machine-lowering-reducer-inl.h around ObjectIs reduction implementation (ObjectIsOp::Kind::kUndetectable handling).

Explanation: This shows where Turboshaft lowering will opt into using the protector to replace undetectable checks with direct null/undefined checks when DependOnNoUndetectableObjectsProtector() returns true, mirroring the high-level typed lowering. It also shows where the broker->dependencies()->DependOnNoUndetectableObjectsProtector() gets called when lowering needs it.
explanation: Records how MachineLoweringReducer consults DependOnNoUndetectableObjectsProtector and when it emits undefined/null checks vs map bit checks.
